availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Emory B. Harlan (Ohio, lieut & assist adj general of Second Division, 49th Illinois Inf)

body.p: Clinton County, Ohio, and Illinois attorney and soldier. Clinton County, Ohio, native. Son of Enoch W. Harlan and Lucinda Buck Harlan. Married to Mary Crundwell Harlan. Father of Emory C. Harlan. Resident of Clinton County in 1850. Law student under Thomas R. Thatcher in Clinton County in 1860. Served in the 49th Illinois Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a second lieutenant and lieutenant from December 1, 1862, to September 1, 1866. Served as lieutenant and assistant adjutant general of the Second Division, Military District of Kentucky, from 1864 to 1865

ab.bibl:
